aligned:
\begin{aligned}
   J^{A}\cdot J^{B} &=-\delta^{AB}\mathbb{1} +\epsilon^{ABC}J^{C} , \\
   J'{}^{A}\cdot J'{}^{B} &= -\delta^{AB}\mathbb{1} +\epsilon^{ABC}J'{}^{C} , \\
   J^{A}\cdot J'{}^{B} &= 0 .
\

\begin{aligned}
   *H &= -{\mathrm e}^{2\Phi} {\mathrm d} ({\mathrm e}^{-2\Phi}) 
      && \qquad \text{for $\SU(2)$} , \\ 
   *H &= -{\mathrm e}^{2\Phi} {\mathrm d} ( {\mathrm e}^{-2\Phi} J ) 
      && \qquad \text{for $\SU(3)$} , \\
   *H &= -{\mathrm e}^{2\Phi}{\mathrm d} ( {\mathrm e}^{-2\Phi}\tfrac{1}{2}J\wedge J )
      && \qquad \text{for $\SU(4)$} .
\

\begin{aligned}
   \mathrm{d} s^2 &= {\mathrm e}^{2\Phi}(\mathrm{d}\tilde s^2)+(\mathrm{d} y+B)^2 , \\
   H_{mnp} &= -\tilde \epsilon_{mnp}{}^l\tilde{\nabla}_l
      {\mathrm e}^{2\Phi}-3B_{[m}G_{np]} , \\ 
   H_{ymn} &= -G_{mn} ,
\

\begin{aligned}
   {\mathrm d} ({\mathrm e}^{-\Phi}K^i ) & = 0 , \\
   {\mathrm d} ({\mathrm e}^{-\Phi}\Omega ) &= 0 , \\
   {\mathrm d} J \wedge K^1 \wedge K^2 &= 0 .
\

\begin{aligned}
  {\mathrm d} ({\mathrm e}^{-\Phi} K) & = 0, \\
  {\mathrm d} ({\mathrm e}^{-\Phi} J) & = 0, \\
  {\mathrm d} ({\mathrm e}^{-\Phi}\re \Omega )\wedge K & = 0,\\
  {\mathrm d} (\im \Omega) \wedge \im \Omega & = 0 
\

\begin{aligned}
   {\mathrm d} \left( {\mathrm e}^{-\Phi} J^A\right) &= 0 ,  \qquad \text{for $A=1,2$}\\
   {\mathrm d}^\dagger ({\mathrm e}^{-2\Phi} J^3) &= 0 ,
\

\begin{aligned}
   \mathrm{d} s^2 &= {\mathrm e}^{2\Phi}\mathrm{d} \tilde s^2 
      +(\mathrm{d} y+B^1)^2 + (\mathrm{d} z+B^2)^2 , \\
   H_{mnp} &= -\tilde\epsilon_{mnp}{}^q\tilde{\nabla}_q {\mathrm e}^{2\Phi}
      + 3B^1_{[m}G^1_{np]} + 3B^2_{[m}G^2_{np]} , \\
   H_{mny} &= G^1_{mn} , \qquad \qquad
   H_{mnz} = G^2_{mn} ,
\

\begin{aligned}
   J &= {\mathrm e}^{2\Phi}\tilde{J} + (\mathrm{d} y+B^1) \wedge (\mathrm{d} z+B^2) , \\
   \Omega &= {\mathrm e}^{2\Phi}\tilde{\Omega} \wedge 
      \left[(\mathrm{d} y+B^1)+ \mathrm{i}(\mathrm{d} z+B^2) \right] ,
\

\begin{aligned}
   \mathrm{d} [{\mathrm e}^{-2\Phi}J\wedge J] &= 0 , \\ 
   \mathrm{d} [{\mathrm e}^{-2\Phi}\Omega \wedge (K^1+\mathrm{i} K^2)] &= 0 , \\
   \mathrm{d} [{\mathrm e}^{-2\Phi}J\wedge K^1 \wedge K^2] &= - {\mathrm e}^{-2\Phi} * H . \\ 
\

\begin{aligned}
   J &= e^{12} + e^{34} + e^{56} + e^{78} , \\
   \Omega &= (e^1+\mathrm{i} e^2)(e^3+\mathrm{i} e^4)(e^5+\mathrm{i} e^6)(e^7+\mathrm{i} e^8) .
\

\begin{aligned}
   \Omega^1 &= \tfrac{1}{2}J^3\wedge J^3 - \tfrac{1}{2}J^2\wedge J^2
      + \mathrm{i} J^2\wedge J^3 , \\
   \Omega^2 &= \tfrac{1}{2}J^1\wedge J^1 - \tfrac{1}{2}J^3\wedge J^3
      + \mathrm{i} J^3\wedge J^1 , \\
   \Omega^3 &= \tfrac{1}{2}J^2\wedge J^2 - \tfrac{1}{2}J^1\wedge J^1
      + \mathrm{i} J^1\wedge J^2 .
\

\begin{aligned}
   \Psi^{(1)} &= \tfrac{1}{2}J^2\wedge J^2 + \tfrac{1}{2}J^3\wedge J^3 
      - \tfrac{1}{2}J^1\wedge J^1 , \\
   \Psi^{(2)} &= \tfrac{1}{2}J^3\wedge J^3 + \tfrac{1}{2}J^1\wedge J^1  
      - \tfrac{1}{2}J^2\wedge J^2 , \\
   \Psi^{(3)} &= \tfrac{1}{2}J^1\wedge J^1 + \tfrac{1}{2}J^2\wedge J^2 
      - \tfrac{1}{2}J^3\wedge J^3 .
\

\begin{aligned}
   \Psi^{(1)} &= \vol + \vol' - J^1 \wedge J'{}^1 + J^2 \wedge J'{}^2
      + J^3 \wedge J'{}^3 , \\
   \Psi^{(2)} &= \vol + \vol' + J^1 \wedge J'{}^1 - J^2 \wedge J'{}^2
      + J^3 \wedge J'{}^3 , \\
   \Psi^{(3)} &= \vol + \vol' + J^1 \wedge J'{}^1 + J^2 \wedge J'{}^2
      - J^3 \wedge J'{}^3 , \\
   \Psi^{(4)} &= \vol + \vol' - J^1 \wedge J'{}^1 - J^2 \wedge J'{}^2
      - J^3 \wedge J'{}^3 .
\

\begin{aligned}
   J &= e^{12} + e^{34} + e^{56} , \\
   \Omega &= (e^1+\mathrm{i} e^2)(e^3+\mathrm{i} e^4)(e^5+\mathrm{i} e^6) . 
\

\begin{aligned}
   J^{(1)} &= J + K^1 \wedge K^2 , &&& 
   \Omega^{(1)} &= \Omega \wedge (K^1 + \mathrm{i} K^2) , \\
   J^{(2)} &= J - K^1 \wedge K^2 , &&&
   \Omega^{(2)} &= \Omega \wedge (K^1 - \mathrm{i} K^2) . 
\

\begin{aligned}
   J &= {\mathrm e}^{2\Phi}(\mathrm{d} x^1\wedge \mathrm{d} x^2-\mathrm{d} x^3\wedge \mathrm{d} x^4)
         + (\mathrm{d} y+B^1)\wedge (\mathrm{d} z+ B^2) , \\
   J' &= {\mathrm e}^{2\Phi}(\mathrm{d} x^1\wedge \mathrm{d} x^2-\mathrm{d} x^3\wedge \mathrm{d} x^4)
         -(\mathrm{d} y+B^1)\wedge (\mathrm{d} z+ B^2) .
\
